node_2: world health organization's recommended doctor-to-population ratio
edge: The for-profit private health sector has a doctor-to-population ratio compared to the World Health Organization's recommended ratio of 1:1,000.
The for-profit private health sector includes world-class health facilities, such as Narayana Health, an internationally accredited, high quality, tertiary healthcare service provider.

The for-profit private health sector includes individual informal provider clinics, establishments providing medical care, often manned by a solo provider who does not have a formal medical qualification or registration.
